verses.verse: (The Perfect Revelation of the LORD) To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David. [1] The (Is. 40:22; (Rom. 1:19, 20)) heavens declare the glory of God; And the (Gen. 1:6, 7) firmament shows His handiwork.
Day unto day utters speech, And night unto night reveals knowledge.
There is no speech nor language Where their voice is not heard.
(Rom. 10:18) Their line has gone out through all the earth, And their words to the end of the world. In them He has set a tabernacle for the sun,
Which is like a bridegroom coming out of his chamber, (Eccl. 1:5) And rejoices like a strong man to run its race.
Its rising is from one end of heaven, And its circuit to the other end; And there is nothing hidden from its heat.
(Ps. 111:7; (Rom. 7:12)) The law of the LORD is perfect, converting the soul; The testimony of the LORD is sure, making (Ps. 119:130) wise the simple;
The statutes of the LORD are right, rejoicing the heart; The commandment of the LORD is pure, enlightening the eyes;
The fear of the LORD is clean, enduring forever; The judgments of the LORD are true and righteous altogether.
